metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3189 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The chrome_pdf::CopyImage function in pdf/draw_utils.cc in the PDFium component in Google Chrome before 38.0.2125.101 does not properly validate image-data dimensions, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) or possibly have unspecified other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
chromium-browser-l10n - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
chromium-chromedriver - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '38.0.2125.111-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1061').
